| A disintegrator:* can [tunnel](/wiki/Tunnel "Tunnel") through walls.
* cannot pick up items.
* has no hands.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* [regenerates HP quickly](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration").
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* wanders randomly.
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* appears only in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless"). |                                                                  |

The **disintegrator** is a type of monster added in the [Biodiversity patch](/wiki/Biodiversity_patch "Biodiversity patch"). Its attack chooses a random worn or wielded piece of equipment to disintegrate, including your main weapon; [cloaks](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") and [shirts](/wiki/Shirt "Shirt") count as one possibility for this purpose. The selected item has a chance of 5% to resist the disintegration (50% for artifact weapons; 100% for [invocation artifacts](/wiki/Invocation_artifacts "Invocation artifacts") and your quest artifact). If this selects a body part that is not covered by armor, you are disintegrated. [Disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance") prevents this attack from disintegrating anything.

Disintegrators also have the passive ability to disintegrate objects they are hit with, including gloves (but not rings) if fighting without a wielded object; as with the active attack, ordinary objects have a 5% chance of resisting while artifacts have a 50% chance. Disintegration resistance does *not* prevent this from happening. However, if you hit a disintegrator without gloves or a weapon and are not disintegration resistant, you disintegrate. Currently, [stethoscopes](/wiki/Stethoscope "Stethoscope") applied to disintegrators do not disintegrate.

Similar to [cockatrices](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice"), disintegrators have an [instant death](/wiki/Instant_death "Instant death") attack which is triggered by touching the monster; this means that you can die by trying to help a disintegrator out of a pit or be disintegrated by trying to saddle a disintegrator (the latter might also cause your saddle to be disintegrated). However, since they never leave corpses, you cannot die by trying to tin one.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Variants](#Variants)
  - [1.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
- [2 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [3 Reference](#Reference)

## Variants

### UnNetHack

As of the latest development version of [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), disintegrators are no longer generated and are not valid [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") forms. Having them appear randomly was deemed too cruel even for (Un)NetHack. They are genocidable, so can be created by [reverse genocide](/wiki/Reverse_genocide "Reverse genocide"), [wishing](/wiki/Wishing "Wishing") for a [figurine](/wiki/Figurine "Figurine"), or [animating](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh") a [statue](/wiki/Statue "Statue").

## Encyclopedia entry

It is true origin story of this monster - see this rgrn thread[\[1\]](#cite_note-1).

\>>when you \*dream about\* the game  
\>>Not just the "Hey, I'm in Nethack!" dream (haven't we \*all\*  
\>>had that one?) but the "sitting at the computer playing" dream.  
(...)  
\>>All of a sudden, a bright green R approached. "Bright green?"  
\>>thought I. And I threw a couple darts at it:  
\>> The blessed rustproof +4 dart hits the disintegrator!  
\>> The blessed rustproof +4 dart disintegrates!  
(...)  
\>> The disintegrator hits! Your cloak crumbles and turns to dust!  
\>> The disintegrator hits! Your armor turns to dust and  
\>> falls to the floor!  
\>>Engrave the E-word?  
\>> Wield what? b - the blessed +2 Magicbane  
\>> The disintegrator hits! The blessed +2 Magicbane dissolves!  
\>> The disintegrator hits! You fall apart!  
\>> DYWYPI?  
\>>Then I woke up and thanked Thoth there's no such thing as  
\>>disintegrators.  
\>I smell a sadistic YANI. DON'T GIVE THE D\*VT\*\*M IDEAS!!!!  
Too late. It is killable, though. At least in wizard mode.  
\[ rec.games.roguelike.nethack,  
  by kcolrawyksthgin, g33kd00d and Nicholas Aodhagan Webb][\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Reference

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) origin story: <https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!msg/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/Q_m-025sR0o/w03iMgeRv1gJ>
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) encyclopedia entry source: <http://sourceforge.net/apps/trac/unnethack/changeset?old_path=%2Ftrunk%2Fdat%2Fdata.base&old=1322&new_path=%2Ftrunk%2Fdat%2Fdata.base&new=1323>

Disintegrator

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
R disintegrator
Difficulty 20
Attacks Claw 4d4 disintegration
R disintegrator
Difficulty 20
Attacks

Claw 4d4 disintegration

Base level 18
Base experience 634
Speed 8
Base AC 0
Base MR 20
Alignment -3 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1000
Nutritional value 0
Size Large
Resistances disintegration, petrification
Resistances conveyed None

A disintegrator:

  • can tunnel through walls.
  • cannot pick up items.
  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • regenerates HP quickly.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • wanders randomly.
  • is nasty.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
  • never leaves a corpse.

The disintegrator is a type of monster added in the Biodiversity patch. Its attack chooses a random worn or wielded piece of equipment to disintegrate, including your main weapon; cloaks, body armor and shirts count as one possibility for this purpose. The selected item has a chance of 5% to resist the disintegration (50% for artifact weapons; 100% for invocation artifacts and your quest artifact). If this selects a body part that is not covered by armor, you are disintegrated. Disintegration resistance prevents this attack from disintegrating anything.

Disintegrators also have the passive ability to disintegrate objects they are hit with, including gloves (but not rings) if fighting without a wielded object; as with the active attack, ordinary objects have a 5% chance of resisting while artifacts have a 50% chance. Disintegration resistance does not prevent this from happening. However, if you hit a disintegrator without gloves or a weapon and are not disintegration resistant, you disintegrate. Currently, stethoscopes applied to disintegrators do not disintegrate.

Similar to cockatrices, disintegrators have an instant death attack which is triggered by touching the monster; this means that you can die by trying to help a disintegrator out of a pit or be disintegrated by trying to saddle a disintegrator (the latter might also cause your saddle to be disintegrated). However, since they never leave corpses, you cannot die by trying to tin one.

Contents

  • 1 Variants
    • 1.1 UnNetHack
  • 2 Encyclopedia entry
  • 3 Reference

Variants

UnNetHack

As of the latest development version of UnNetHack, disintegrators are no longer generated and are not valid polymorph forms. Having them appear randomly was deemed too cruel even for (Un)NetHack. They are genocidable, so can be created by reverse genocide, wishing for a figurine, or animating a statue.

Encyclopedia entry

It is true origin story of this monster - see this rgrn thread[1].

>>when you *dream about* the game
>>Not just the "Hey, I'm in Nethack!" dream (haven't we *all*
>>had that one?) but the "sitting at the computer playing" dream.
(...)
>>All of a sudden, a bright green R approached. "Bright green?"
>>thought I. And I threw a couple darts at it:
>> The blessed rustproof +4 dart hits the disintegrator!
>> The blessed rustproof +4 dart disintegrates!
(...)
>> The disintegrator hits! Your cloak crumbles and turns to dust!
>> The disintegrator hits! Your armor turns to dust and
>> falls to the floor!
>>Engrave the E-word?
>> Wield what? b - the blessed +2 Magicbane
>> The disintegrator hits! The blessed +2 Magicbane dissolves!
>> The disintegrator hits! You fall apart!
>> DYWYPI?
>>Then I woke up and thanked Thoth there's no such thing as
>>disintegrators.
>I smell a sadistic YANI. DON'T GIVE THE D*VT**M IDEAS!!!!
Too late. It is killable, though. At least in wizard mode.
[ rec.games.roguelike.nethack,
  by kcolrawyksthgin, g33kd00d and Nicholas Aodhagan Webb][2]

 |size=Large

The '''disintegrator''' is a type of monster added in the [[Biodiversity patch]]. Its attack chooses a random worn or wielded piece of equipment to disintegrate, including your main weapon; [[cloak]]s, [[body armor]] and [[shirt]]s count as one possibility for this purpose. The selected item has a chance of 5% to resist the disintegration (50% for artifact weapons; 100% for [[invocation artifacts]] and your quest artifact). If this selects a body part that is not covered by armor, you are disintegrated. [[Disintegration resistance]] prevents this attack from disintegrating anything.

Disintegrators also have the passive ability to disintegrate objects they are hit with, including gloves (but not rings) if fighting without a wielded object; as with the active attack, ordinary objects have a 5% chance of resisting while artifacts have a 50% chance. Disintegration resistance does ''not'' prevent this from happening. However, if you hit a disintegrator without gloves or a weapon and are not disintegration resistant, you disintegrate. Currently, [[stethoscope]]s applied to disintegrators do not disintegrate.

Similar to [[cockatrice]]s, disintegrators have an [[instant death]] attack which is triggered by touching the monster; this means that you can die by trying to help a disintegrator out of a pit or be disintegrated by trying to saddle a disintegrator (the latter might also cause your saddle to be disintegrated). However, since they never leave corpses, you cannot die by trying to tin one.

==Variants==

===UnNetHack===

As of the latest development version of [[UnNetHack]], disintegrators are no longer generated and are not valid [[polymorph]] forms. Having them appear randomly was deemed too cruel even for (Un)NetHack. They are genocidable, so can be created by [[reverse genocide]], [[wishing]] for a [[figurine]], or [[Stone to flesh|animating]] a [[statue]].

==Encyclopedia entry==

It is true origin story of this monster - see this rgrn thread<ref>origin story: https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!msg/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/Q_m-025sR0o/w03iMgeRv1gJ</ref>.
